DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma Inflammatory Infiltrate Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not an inflammatory infiltrate response is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common morphologic subtype of urinary bladder carcinoma (over 90% of cases).  It arises from the transitional epithelium.  It most often affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation.  Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.__A microscopic finding indicating the presence of acute, subacute or chronic inflammation in a tissue sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common morphologic subtype of urinary bladder carcinoma (over 90% of cases).  It arises from the transitional epithelium.  It most often affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation.  Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the urothelial lining of the bladder.  It is the most common morphologic type of urinary bladder carcinoma. It usually affects males in their sixth and seventh decades of life.  Hematuria is the most common symptom at presentation. Pathologic stage is the strongest predictor of survival.

Property.preferredDefinition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of acute, subacute or chronic inflammation in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of acute, subacute or chronic inflammation in a tissue sample.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA Bladder EPC per request by J.Demchok. mc 1/31/13 Released per approval by John. mc 3/20/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
